Commands Functions

changeBackground

  • changeBackground(__namedParameters: { color?: string; image?: string; scene: Scene }): void

  • Change the background by using either a color (given by a string) or an image URL

    example
    kepler.changeBackground( {scene, color: '#7777777'} )

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { color?: string; image?: string; scene: Scene }
      • Optional color?: string
      • Optional image?: string
      • scene: Scene

    Returns void

changeView

  • changeView(view: string, __namedParameters: { camera: Camera; controls: TrackballControls; scene: Scene }): void

  • Change the view of the scene

    example
    kepler.changeView('north', controls)

    Parameters

    • view: string

      Possible values are up, down, east, west, north, south

    • __namedParameters: { camera: Camera; controls: TrackballControls; scene: Scene }
      • camera: Camera
      • controls: TrackballControls

        The Trackball controls

      • scene: Scene

    Returns void

createDefaultLights

  • createDefaultLights(__namedParameters?: { intensity?: number; object?: Object3D; scaling?: number }): Group

  • Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { intensity?: number; object?: Object3D; scaling?: number } = ...
      • Optional intensity?: number
      • Optional object?: Object3D
      • Optional scaling?: number

    Returns Group

fitScene

  • fitScene(__namedParameters: { camera: PerspectiveCamera; controls: TrackballControls; fitRatio?: number; scene?: any; selection?: Object3D[] | Object3D }): void

  • Fit a scene or a specific object or array of objects. The default value for the fitRatio is 1.2

    example
    kepler.fitScene( {scene, camera, controls} )

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { camera: PerspectiveCamera; controls: TrackballControls; fitRatio?: number; scene?: any; selection?: Object3D[] | Object3D }
      • camera: PerspectiveCamera
      • controls: TrackballControls
      • Optional fitRatio?: number
      • Optional scene?: any
      • Optional selection?: Object3D[] | Object3D

    Returns void

pickObject

  • pickObject(__namedParameters: { camera: Camera; event: MouseEvent; scene: Scene }): any

  • Pick (or not) an object

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { camera: Camera; event: MouseEvent; scene: Scene }
      • camera: Camera
      • event: MouseEvent
      • scene: Scene

    Returns any

zoomToIntersection

  • zoomToIntersection(__namedParameters: { camera: Camera; controls: any; duration?: number; event: MouseEvent; scene: any; zoomFactor?: number }): void

  • Zoom to the intersected point with animation (duration). If nothing is picked, the model is centered and unzoom until fitting the whole scene

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { camera: Camera; controls: any; duration?: number; event: MouseEvent; scene: any; zoomFactor?: number }
      • camera: Camera
      • controls: any
      • Optional duration?: number
      • event: MouseEvent
      • scene: any
      • Optional zoomFactor?: number

    Returns void

zoomToModel

  • zoomToModel(__namedParameters: { camera: Camera; controls: any; duration?: number; scene: any }): void

  • Center and fit the scene using animation

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { camera: Camera; controls: any; duration?: number; scene: any }
      • camera: Camera
      • controls: any
      • Optional duration?: number
      • scene: any

    Returns void

Skins Functions

createBBox

  • createBBox(object: Object3D, parameters: BBoxParameters): LineSegments
  • brief

    Place a bounding box (lines) around an object

    example
    const s = createBBox({
     object: scene,
     parameters: new BBoxParameters({
         color: '#000000',
         visible: false
     })
})

    Parameters

    • object: Object3D
    • parameters: BBoxParameters

    Returns LineSegments

createIsoContours

  • createIsoContours(mesh: Mesh, attribute: ASerie, __namedParameters?: { material?: Material; parameters?: IsoContoursParameters }): any
  • example

    Create 2 iso-contours: one filled and one with lines

    scene.add( kepler.createIsoContours(
  surface,
  df.get(surfaceInfo.attr), {
     parameters: new kepler.IsoContoursParameters({
         color: '#ffffff',
         nbr: 10,
         filled: true
     })
  })
)

scene.add( kepler.createIsoContours(
  surface,
  df.get(surfaceInfo.attr), {
     parameters: new kepler.IsoContoursParameters({
         color: '#000000',
         nbr: 10,
         filled: false
     })
  })
)

    Parameters

    • mesh: Mesh
    • attribute: ASerie
    • __namedParameters: { material?: Material; parameters?: IsoContoursParameters } = ...
      • Optional material?: Material
      • Optional parameters?: IsoContoursParameters

    Returns any

createIsoSurfaces

  • createIsoSurfaces(__namedParameters: { attribute: ASerie; grid: ImplicitGrid3D; material?: Material; parameters?: IsoSurfaceParameters }): Object3D

  • Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { attribute: ASerie; grid: ImplicitGrid3D; material?: Material; parameters?: IsoSurfaceParameters }
      • attribute: ASerie
      • grid: ImplicitGrid3D
      • Optional material?: Material
      • Optional parameters?: IsoSurfaceParameters

    Returns Object3D

  • createLineset(__namedParameters: { material?: Material; parameters?: LinesetParameters; position: ASerie | BufferGeometry }): Line

  • Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { material?: Material; parameters?: LinesetParameters; position: ASerie | BufferGeometry }
      • Optional material?: Material
      • Optional parameters?: LinesetParameters
      • position: ASerie | BufferGeometry

    Returns Line

createPointset

  • createPointset(__namedParameters: { material?: Material; parameters?: PointsetParameters; position: ASerie | BufferGeometry }): Points

  • Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { material?: Material; parameters?: PointsetParameters; position: ASerie | BufferGeometry }
      • Optional material?: Material
      • Optional parameters?: PointsetParameters
      • position: ASerie | BufferGeometry

    Returns Points

createSurface

  • createSurface(__namedParameters: { indices: IArray; material?: Material; parameters?: SurfaceParameters; positions: IArray }): Mesh
  • brief

    Generate a 3D surface from positions and indices

    example
    const surface = createSurface({
    positions: dataframe.get('positions'),
    indices  : dataframe.get('indices'),
    parameters: new SurfaceParameters({
        color: '#ff0000',
        flat: true,
        opacity: 0.7,
        creaseAngle: 30 // in degrees
    })
})

const attribute = dataframe.get('U').map( u => u[0] )
paintAttribute(surface, attribute )

const skin = createIsoContourLines({
    geometry : surface.geometry,
    attribute: attribute,
    parameters: new IsoContoursParameters({
        color: '#999900',
        nbr: 10,
        min; 0.2,
        max: 0.8
    })
})

scene.add( surface )
surface.add( skin )

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { indices: IArray; material?: Material; parameters?: SurfaceParameters; positions: IArray }
      • indices: IArray
      • Optional material?: Material
      • Optional parameters?: SurfaceParameters
      • positions: IArray

    Returns Mesh

createVectors

  • createVectors(__namedParameters: { attribute: ASerie; geometry: BufferGeometry; material?: Material; parameters?: VectorsParameters; vectorField?: ASerie }): LineSegments

  • Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { attribute: ASerie; geometry: BufferGeometry; material?: Material; parameters?: VectorsParameters; vectorField?: ASerie }
      • attribute: ASerie
      • geometry: BufferGeometry
      • Optional material?: Material
      • Optional parameters?: VectorsParameters
      • Optional vectorField?: ASerie

    Returns LineSegments

deform

  • deform(__namedParameters: { attribute: IArray; geometry: BufferGeometry; parameters?: DeformParameters }): ASerie
  • example
    const s = createSurface( df.get('positions').array, df.get('indices').array )
const newGeom = deform( s.geometry, df.get('U').array )

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { attribute: IArray; geometry: BufferGeometry; parameters?: DeformParameters }
      • attribute: IArray
      • geometry: BufferGeometry
      • Optional parameters?: DeformParameters

    Returns ASerie

installNavigationCube

  • installNavigationCube(params: NavigationCubeParameters): NavigationCube

  • Parameters

    • params: NavigationCubeParameters

    Returns NavigationCube

paintAttribute

  • paintAttribute(mesh: Mesh, attribute: ASerie, parameters?: PaintParameters): void
  • brief

    Paint a pointset, a lineset or a surface using a scalar attribute provided by a Serie from the library @youwol/dataframe

    example
    const surface = io.loadGocad(filename)[0] // a dataframe I think

let mesh = createSurface({
     positions: surface.get('positions'),
     indices  : surface.get('indices')
})

paintAttribute(mesh, surface.get('U').map( u => u[0] ) )

    Parameters

    • mesh: Mesh
    • attribute: ASerie
    • Optional parameters: PaintParameters

    Returns void
